intro: Ascotainia hongkongensis, commonly known as the Hong Kong ascotainia, is a rare flowering plant native to Hong Kong. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
